reviews.sentence: Cleaned daily spacious in size comfortable beds. Extra towels provided when asked. We stayed on the 7th floor which was very near the pool. Loved having the pool just down the hallway. Needed extra towels every day and received them everyday after we asked for them from hotel cleaning staff. Breakfast served in room and loved that. Good wait service each morning we had our breakfast delivered. King size bed very comfortable extra soft pillows. There is no free continental breakfast at this hotel. A C was a little too cold for us. There is a mall in this same building located on 3rd 2nd and 1st floor. So cool.

Cleaned daily spacious in size comfortable beds. Extra towels provided when asked. We stayed on the 7th floor which was very near the pool. Loved having the pool just down the hallway. Needed extra towels every day and received them everyday after we asked for them from hotel cleaning staff. Breakfast served in room and loved that. Good wait service each morning we had our breakfast delivered. King size bed very comfortable extra soft pillows. There is no free continental breakfast at this hotel. A C was a little too cold for us. There is a mall in this same building located on 3rd 2nd and 1st floor. So cool.

Great Inner Harbor Location. We recently spent a night here with our 8 year old granddaughter. The location was perfect short walking distance to inner harbor attractions. The room was very clean and comfortable. Indoor pool was great. My only complaint was no free wi if in the rooms at this price it should be included.

Very nice hotel but pricey. Very nice hotel. Spacious rooms with spacious bath. Beautiful lobby and sitting area. However when you pay this much money for a hotel it should be assumed that breakfast is included. Come on all average hotels offer complimentary coffee. If you are the best should not you do the same. Location is the best feature for this hotel. It is so close to walk to the Aquarium Harbor etc. Parking is 30 per night. The best surprise of the hotel to us was the indoor swimming pool. With two kids who always get their best times in the hotel swimming pool we parents were surprised to find a lounge like area in the pool room. They had nice seating with magazines so that parents could relax while watching over kids if not swimming. The staff was very courteous and friendly.

Big hotel cGreat location but pool changing room is coed. 45 out of 5This hotel is across the street from the harbor and is integrated into a shopping mall convenient for dining and shopping. We came away with a great overall impression of the hotel. it is sufficiently well decorated spotlessly clean and staffed with friendly people. In short I had return here even though the changing rooms at the pool are coed. We had two rooms on the 12th floor which is the executive level. On weekdays this level affords you access to breakfast and snacks at the private lounge right on your floor. We were in Baltimore Fri. and Sat. so our perk was gratuitous bottled water en suite and breakfast buffet vouchers for the dining area on the 4th floor. We liked the made to order omelette station but the buffet had everything except waffles. You can sample fresh pineapple strawberries blueberries blackberries croissants muffins pancakes chicken sausage turkey bacon as well as porcine varieties of sausage and bacon. More about the rooms They did not knock off our socks with their stylish decor or swank bathrooms but they were not shabby. We booked each room at a special rate of 120 night and feel the price was worth it for the convenience of the location. One of our rooms had a super soft king sized bed but a smallish bathroom. It had a view of a few tall buildings and a parking garage. The best feature of the room was a meter long stone surface handy for pouring over a fold out map for those of us who still find them practical or setting out clothes. Our three kids 1 brawny teenager 1 waif of a twen and 1 athletic child holed up in this room. I was glad they chose it because a car alarm went off in the wee hours Sat. morning. Its sound was faint but roused me from sleep even though the children did not notice it light sleepers bewareThe room were we slept faced East and had a super soft queen sized bed. It overlooked a soulless courtyard but had such a spacious bathroom I was surprised that it did not have grab bars for handicap access. A wheelchair would easily fit into the space for that matter I had rate the hotel and immediate environs convenient for the handicap. Rooms facing the courtyard are best for light sleepers. My photo shows the sun lit pool area as seen from above. The pool is a nice size and depth for children 2 3 m 3 5 feet deep. It is not ideal for swimming laps. The changing room is perfectly clean but men and women share the same changing facilities. We found the co ed aspect convenient since we had the pool almost entirely to ourselves but even though I have lived in continental Europe over a dozen years I dislike shared facilities. Kids are unpredictable and 9 times out of 10 I get exposed. Renaissance needs to provide more privacy in this space.

Perfect Location. I have stayed here before and do not bother trying any other place. The rooms are large and clean the TV is at least a 50 and the location is right in the middle of everything at the inner harbor. Indoor pool was nice for the kids to play and the hotel has been nicely updated in the main areas. No complaints.

luxury and afordability in the heart of the city. I have always wanted to stay at this hotel since I was a little girl. Finally my fiance and I decided to take advantage of the long new years eve and day weekend and go for it. We renter a king size full harbor view room and loved every moment of our stay. The room was on the 10th floor and huge. Came with bonoculars and a site seeing guide of things to spot from our window. There was a fridge and microwave. Very well appointed gym and comfortable pool spa indoors. The property is I walking rage to all the downtown hot spots and restaurants however we never left the building besides to window shop in the connected 4 level shopping mall which the hotel has its own private controlled access entrance to. For dinner we got caryout from the hotel restaurant and had drinks while we waited. To top off our stay we ordered the romance package over the phone the night before we checked in and had the option of calling downstairs for its delivery when we were ready for it or to have it ready and waiting for us in the room apon check in. The package was very reasonably priced at 63 and included a full sized bottle of brut champagne on ice 8 chocolate covered strawberries continental cheese plate fresh fruit plate and two champagne flutes. We had an amazing stay in this top notch hotel and loved every moment.

A wonderful family friendly getaway. My husband had to go to Baltimore for work over a weekend so our 16month old son and I decided to tag along. the hotel staff could not have been friendlier and more accommodating. Our room was spacious spotless and very comfortable the pack and play we had requested was already set up and ready to go for my son after our long drive. Great place to stay with kids the staff did not even blink when my son spilled his milk in the restaurant the heated indoor pool was a haven for kids of all ages in the hotel and there was plenty of room for him to run around the spacious property. Would definitely recommend staying here plus you can not beat the location just across the street from the inner harbors restaurants aquarium and other activities.

very nice hotel and staff. last week stayed here at this huge hotel for nieces wedding and enjoyed it very much. the staff was so kind and helpful and went out of their way to make sure things were perfect. the hotel was very well maintained and very clean. housekeeping ladies were so kind and caring. loved the indoor swim pool and jacuzi. swam there often especially very early in the morning before the crowd. loved the gym. good exercise equipment and very clean and well maintained. loved the sunday morning brunch with plenty of choices of what to eat and drink including chocolate milk.
Exceptional. Desk clerks were awesome. Pool was freezing cold.

We can not wait to explore Baltimore some more. We were able to check in right away and we got there at 100 am for the aquarium. Because it was my daughters birthday trip we got a free upgrade to a Harbor View and it was so nice to see the whole harbor. The pool was really cold the water should maybe be warmer for an indoor pool. My oldest is 8 and was okay getting in but my 2 year old was freezing. Was hoping to get more time in there. Facility was nice though. We heard a baby cry a lot next door but that was not the hotels fault.

It would have been nice to know Construction runs all the way to 6 pm. The bed feels amazing close to everything the decor of the hotel is very modern and uptodate the staff was nicethe construction that we were not informed of that went on until 6 pm. The fact the indoor pool was freezing and the hot tub was out of order withn the most disgusting white film just floating on top. Also my reservation was not ready at 3 pm but they did switch us to another room. The rosemary soaps burned and smelled horrible. Watch when validating your parking I was charged for valet parking and not self parking.

Very disappointed with pool which was freezing the jacuzi was hot but not full enough resulting in scum line around top and loud vents blowing out around your ears that should have been below water level.

Loved how close it was to the inner harbor. Was a little disappointed to be in a room that was n’t updated yet. It was clear that the beds need to be updated it was an uncomfortable sleep. Also our toilet ran for most of the night it was extremely loud. We could hear the construction during the day but not too bad. The soda machine on our floor was completely sold out. I do think 15 p is a bit steep for a continental breakfast. The lobby was nice the staff was extremely nice and pleasant. The pool was clean but the hot tub was making a terrible noise. I ’d be willing to try again in an updated room.
Booked this hotel for the indoor pool to only find out it was n’t open are entire stay.
A lot of noise caused by the pool repair. Fortunatly it stopped at about 210 hours each night.

ITS WAS VERY NICE CLEAN THE ONLY THING I DIDNT LIKE THEY ARE SHOWING AND SAYING. THEY HAVE A POOL WHEN THEY DONT ANYMORE I WAS VERY. DISAPPOINTED. I CAME ALL THE WAY FROM JERSEY. AND I WAS LOOKING. FORWARD. TO GETTING. WET.
